activities: Only human resources data is covered by the Safe Harbor Frameworks. Personal information collected online and offline in connection with BAE System’s business activities, including information concerning current, prospective and former employees. BAE Systems receives information from the EU concerning prospective, current and former employees, consultants, contractors and job applicants for processing and storage. BAE Systems collects, transfers, and uses this data for purposes of employee benefits and workforce management. This includes evaluation of qualifications for employment, provision of employment benefits, reporting, security management, administration of compensation, performance management and training, workforce management, budgeting and salary administration, business contact directory, company network access, authentication, personalization and legal compliance.
contacttitle1: Vice President, Workforce Relations and Compliance
eucountries: Germany, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs) Panel and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) (for EU/Swiss human resources data only).
